data.title: Join Our Team
data.meta_description: Are you interested in working for a dynamic, caring organization that provides quality, comprehensive health care for all in Northwest Arkansas? We want to hear from you! Community Clinic has over 300 employees, and we are always looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team. We offer all full-time employees a generous benefit package […]
data.text:
Springdale Job Postings

Health Coach

Community Clinic is seeking Health Coaches to work in our medical clinics throughout Northwest Arkansas. The Health Coach is a member of a multidisciplinary team, serving as the link between patients and their healthcare providers, social services and community resources. Key responsibilities include conducting patient needs assessments, providing health coaching to a panel of patients with chronic conditions, as well as facilitating case management and coordination of services. An associate’s degree or higher is preferred. Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus. Upon hire, the selected candidate will be required to successfully complete an employer-sponsored health coach training and certification course. These are full-time positions, M-F. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Patient Coordinator

Community Clinic is seeking a Bilingual Patient Coordinator (Front Desk). English/Spanish or English/Marshallese is required. Must have strong computer skills, excellent customer service skills and the ability to multi-task. Position is full-time, M-F. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Human Resources Manager

Community Clinic is seeking an experienced Human Resources Manager. Key responsibilities include recruiting, maintaining the applicant data bank, interviewing, new employee onboarding, assisting with benefits, and general administrative duties. A college degree and 5-7 years of experience in Human Resources is preferred. SHRM certification is a plus. This is a full-time position, M – F. Excellent benefits package including: Insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Women’s Health Nurse

Community Clinic is seeking a full-time Nurse for a busy clinic providing quality, comprehensive primary health care. A current Arkansas nursing license is required. This is a full time position, M-F, 8-5. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b) retirement, PTO and paid holidays.

Lab Technician

Community Clinic is seeking an experienced Lab Technician for a busy family practice clinic. Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred. Full time, M –F. Excellent benefits package including: Insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Project Coordinator

Community Clinic is seeking a full-time Project Coordinator to work with its NWA Tobacco and Drug Free Coalition program. This position is responsible for the facilitation of local tobacco prevention and control initiatives in Washington County. Responsibilities include grants management, program development, compliance monitoring, community relations and event promotion. Occasional weekend work and in-state travel is required. Strong computer skills are essential.

B.S. or B.A. required. Experience in one of more of the following areas preferred; health education, social work, public relations, political science, communications, volunteer development, or community development. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Behavioral Health Case Manager

Community Clinic is seeking a full-time bilingual Behavioral Health Case Manager to provide holistic and comprehensive case management services to its patients. The Case Manager works closely with a patient’s care team, including the provider, nurses, medical assistants, behavioral health consultants, and patient advocates. Bilingual (Spanish/English) is required. Key responsibilities include care coordination, working referrals, case management, progress monitoring, education, and advocacy. A Bachelor’s degree in social work or related field is preferred. Excellent benefits package including: insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Medical Assistant

Community Clinic is seeking a bilingual Medical Assistant for a busy family practice clinic. MA, RMA or CNA certification is required. English/Spanish or English/Marshallese is preferred. This is a full time position, M-F, 8-5. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Pediatric Nurse

Community Clinic is seeking a full-time Pediatric Nurse for a busy clinic providing quality, comprehensive primary health care. A current Arkansas nursing license is required. At least one year experience in pediatrics is preferred. This is a full time position, M-F, 8-5. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b) retirement, PTO and paid holidays.

Patient Coordinator (School-based Health Center)

Community Clinic is seeking a bilingual Patient Coordinator (Front Desk) for a busy school-based health clinic. English/Spanish is required. Must have strong computer skills, excellent customer service skills and the ability to multi-task. Position is full-time, M-F. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

APRN SBHC

Community Clinic is seeking a Family Practice APRN for a busy school-based health clinic serving students, faculty and families in the surrounding community. This is a full time position, M – F. Excellent benefits package including professional liability coverage, CME, insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Referral Specialist

Community Clinic is seeking a Referral Specialist. This position is responsible for processing referral requests initiated by medical providers. Responsibilities include completing and tracking required documentation, verifying patient eligibility, reviewing details with patients, and monthly reporting. Knowledge of medical terminology a plus. This is a full-time position, M – F, 8-5. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b) retirement, PTO and paid holidays.

Call Center Agent

Community Clinic is currently seeking a Call Center Agent for a high volume call center serving our clinics in Northwest Arkansas. Bilingual English/ Spanish or English/Marshallese is required. Job responsibilities include excellent computer and data entry skills, outstanding customer service skills and the ability to handle high call volumes while multi-tasking. Position is full-time, M-F, with an excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b) retirement, PTO and paid holidays.

Rogers Job Postings

Physician

Community Clinic is seeking a full-time, family practice physician. M-F, no weekends! Excellent benefits package including: Federal Malpractice Coverage, CME, insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Family Practice APRN

Community Clinic is seeking a Family Practice APRN. This is a full time position, M – F. Excellent benefits package including: Professional liability coverage, CME, insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Pediatric Nurse

Community Clinic is seeking a full-time Pediatric Nurse for a busy clinic providing quality, comprehensive primary health care. A current Arkansas nursing license is required. At least one year experience in pediatrics is preferred. This is a full time position, M-F, 8-5. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b) retirement, PTO and paid holidays.

Care Coordinator

Community Clinic is seeking a Care Coordinator for our Rogers medical clinic. This position works with the multidisciplinary team to promote patient engagement and health promotion throughout the care continuum by facilitating timely, appropriate health care delivery resulting in improved patient outcomes. A current Arkansas LPN license is required. Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus. This is a full-time position, M – F. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Patient Coordinator

Community Clinic is seeking a Patient Coordinator (Front Desk) for its Advanced Health & Wellness location in Fayetteville, AR. Must have strong computer skills, excellent customer service skills and the ability to multi-task. Position is full-time, M-F. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Lab Technician

Community Clinic is seeking an experienced Lab Technician for a busy family practice clinic. Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred. Full time, M –F. Excellent benefits package including: Insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Physical Therapist Technician

Community Clinic is seeking a Physical Therapist Technician to work under the direct supervision of a licensed Physical Therapist. Key responsibilities include performing client treatment programs and activities, providing technical assistance regarding therapeutic programs, and preparing patients for treatment. Must be bi-lingual (English/Spanish). This position is full time, M- F. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Health Coach

Community Clinic is seeking Health Coaches to work in our medical clinics throughout Northwest Arkansas. The Health Coach is a member of a multidisciplinary team, serving as the link between patients and their healthcare providers, social services and community resources. Key responsibilities include conducting patient needs assessments, providing health coaching to a panel of patients with chronic conditions, as well as facilitating case management and coordination of services. An associate’s degree or higher is preferred. Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus. Upon hire, the selected candidate will be required to successfully complete an employer-sponsored health coach training and certification course. These are full-time positions, M-F. Excellent benefits package including insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.

Medical Records Specialist

Community Clinic is seeking an experienced Medical Records Specialist. This position is responsible for the overall organization and security of electronic patient medical records. Confidentiality and legal compliance are critical aspects of this position. Strong written and verbal skills are a must. A minimum of 1 year previous experience is required. This position is full-time, M-F. Excellent benefits package including: insurance, 403(b), PTO and paid holidays.
